text.School of Visual Arts and Design: School of Visual Arts and Design

p.The Art BA, Visual Arts Management track: The Art BA, Visual Arts Management track enable students to explore the management side of the Visual Arts environment while providing a solid foundation in techniques and theory. A minor or approved area of emphasis is required to compliment the degree or explore a different area of interest. As part of the program, some courses study the form and proportion of the human figure nude models are used as reference.

li.Students who change degree programs and: Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
li.Students are required to complete a mino: Students are required to complete a minor or an area of concentration to graduate. Examples of minors are listed below under "Additional Information," Students may choose another minor, not on the list, after consulting with their advisor.
li.Students who complete a double major ful: Students who complete a double major fulfill the minor or area ofconcentration requirement automatically.
li.Departmental Residency Requirement consi: Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 18 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF School of Visual Arts and Design.
li.The Studio Art Portfolio is NOT required: The Studio Art Portfolio is NOT required for this track. However, if a student wishes to enroll in upper level portfolio restricted Studio Art courses, they will need to successfully complete the Studio Art Portfolio.
li.Students must earn at least a \"C\" (2.0: Students must earn at least a "C" (2.0) in each course required for the major.
li.Co-op internship credits are not permitt: Co-op internship credits are not permitted in this major without prior written permission.
li.Students should consult with their SVAD: Students should consult with their SVAD advisor each semester.

courseSection0.text:
The Art BA, Visual Arts Management track enable students to explore the management side of the Visual Arts environment while providing a solid foundation in techniques and theory. A minor or approved area of emphasis is required to compliment the degree or explore a different area of interest. As part of the program, some courses study the form and proportion of the human figure nude models are used as reference.
Admission Requirements
None
Degree Requirements
Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
Students are required to complete a minor or an area of concentration to graduate. Examples of minors are listed below under "Additional Information," Students may choose another minor, not on the list, after consulting with their advisor.
Students who complete a double major fulfill the minor or area ofconcentration requirement automatically.
Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 18 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF School of Visual Arts and Design.
The Studio Art Portfolio is NOT required for this track. However, if a student wishes to enroll in upper level portfolio restricted Studio Art courses, they will need to successfully complete the Studio Art Portfolio.
Students must earn at least a "C" (2.0) in each course required for the major.
Co-op internship credits are not permitted in this major without prior written permission.
Students should consult with their SVAD advisor each semester.

p.Acceptable Substitutes for common progra: Acceptable Substitutes for common program prerequisites if taken prior to transferring to UCF:
p.*Recommend taking 3XXX or 4XXX to satisf: *Recommend taking 3XXX or 4XXX to satisfy this requirement.

li.Select primarily from upper level course: Select primarily from upper level courses, with school advisor's approval. May be outside of the school. (A maximum of six hours of Independent Study, Practicum, or Internship permitted)
li.Proficiency equivalent to one year of co: Proficiency equivalent to one year of college instruction in a single foreign language taught by the Department of Modern Languages and Literatures or the Department of History (Hebrew). Standardized examinations for foreign languages may be used to meet the requirement.
li.Signature Experience requirement is met: Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):
li.ART 4859C - Visual Arts Management BA Ca: ART 4859C - Visual Arts Management BA Capstone Credit Hours: 3
li.Students must complete a minor of at lea: Students must complete a minor of at least 18 hours. See selected discipline for Minor requirements, information, and changes. University upper division credit hour requirements must be met. Students are discouraged from taking excess hours and should consider total credit hours required when selecting a minor. When no official minor is offered, students may complete an 18-credit-hour area of concentration when pre-approved by the program Area Coordinator.
li.Achieve at least a 2.0 GPA in all course: Achieve at least a 2.0 GPA in all courses used to satisfy major requirements.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Students interested in completing Honors: Students interested in completing Honors in the Major should contact their program advisor. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at http://research.honors.ucf.edu/honors-in-the-major. Up to 6 hours can be used toward elective, hours must be complete through SVAD.
li.Grades less than a \"C\" (2.0) are not a: Grades less than a "C" (2.0) are not accepted.
li.Lower division courses do not substitute: Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred from private and out: Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide supporting information.
li.GRA 2101C may substitute for 3 hours of: GRA 2101C may substitute for 3 hours of any digital art course.
li.Program Academic Learning Compacts (stud: Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

h3.Required Minor or Area of Concentration: Required Minor or Area of Concentration (18 Credit Hours)

courseSection0.text:
Electives

Select primarily from upper level courses, with school advisor's approval. May be outside of the school. (A maximum of six hours of Independent Study, Practicum, or Internship permitted)

courseSection1.text:
Foreign Language Requirements

Admissions
Met by graduation requirement
Graduation
Proficiency equivalent to one year of college instruction in a single foreign language taught by the Department of Modern Languages and Literatures or the Department of History (Hebrew). Standardized examinations for foreign languages may be used to meet the requirement.

courseSection2.text:
Additional Requirements
Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):

ART 4859C - Visual Arts Management BA Capstone Credit Hours: 3

Required Minor or Area of Concentration (18 Credit Hours)

Students must complete a minor of at least 18 hours. See selected discipline for Minor requirements, information, and changes. University upper division credit hour requirements must be met. Students are discouraged from taking excess hours and should consider total credit hours required when selecting a minor. When no official minor is offered, students may complete an 18-credit-hour area of concentration when pre-approved by the program Area Coordinator.

courseSection3.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Achieve at least a 2.0 GPA in all courses used to satisfy major requirements.

courseSection4.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection6.text:
Additional Information

Honors In Major
Students interested in completing Honors in the Major should contact their program advisor. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at http://research.honors.ucf.edu/honors-in-the-major. Up to 6 hours can be used toward elective, hours must be complete through SVAD.
Related Programs
None
Certificates
None
Related Minors
Art History Minor
Business Minor
Digital Humanities Minor
Digital Media Minor
Entrepreneurship Minor
Event Management Minor
Film, Cinema Studies Minor
Magazine Journalism Minor
Marketing Minor
Public Administration Minor
Technological Entrepreneurship Minor
Theatre Minor
Advising Notes
http://svad.cah.ucf.edu/advising
svadadvising@ucf.edu
Transfer Notes
Grades less than a "C" (2.0) are not accepted.
Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide supporting information.
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
Acceptable Substitutes for common program prerequisites if taken prior to transferring to UCF:
GRA 2101C may substitute for 3 hours of any digital art course.
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
Equipment Fees
Part-Time Student: $31.50 per term
Full-Time Student: $63 per term
